text: Jean Bourgain (28 February 1954 - 22 December 2018) was a Belgian mathematician. He was a professor at University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign and Institut des hautes études scientifiques at Bures-sur-Yvette in France. From 1994 until his death he has worked at the Institute for Advanced Study in Princeton, New Jersey.Biography: Jean Bourgain , University of St Andrews, Scotland He was an editor for the Annals of Mathematics. He received his Ph.D. from the Vrije Universiteit Brussel in 1977. He received the Fields Medal in 1994. In 2008 he was elected a foreign member of the Academia Europaea. In 2009 Bourgain was elected a foreign member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences.Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences: Many new members elected to the Academy , press release on 12 February 2009 In 2010 he received the Shaw Prize in Mathematics. In 2012 he and Terence Tao received the Crafoord Prize in Mathematics from the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences.Crafoord Press Release on 19 January 2012 Bourgain died on 22 December 2018 in Bonheiden, Belgium at the age of 64.Décès du mathématicien Jean Bourgain ==References== Category:Fields Medalists Category:1954 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Belgian mathematicians Category:People from West Flanders Category:Members of Academia Europaea
